results.title: If you are not part of the solution...you are part of the problem
results.creator_credit: Libby Lloyd, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: Violence against women is possibly the most important, least examined and most taboo subject in our society. This film explores the beginnings of White Ribbon Day and the campaign to making it an important high profile public awareness day in Australia.

results.title: I think it's going to rain today
results.creator_credit: Joan Hobson, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: The icy winter storm of abuse that a 14 year-old boy can bring upon a family. The unleashing of anger to deliberate acts of violence. Summer will come again but it will just take awhile.

results.title: Finding me
results.creator_credit: Joy Chivers, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joy Chivers, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.

results.title: The Sound Before You Make It
results.brief_description: Free-standing Zoetrope using strobe lighting to create the illusion of figures ‘dancing’ to Michael Jackson beat.
results.description: Free-standing Zoetrope using strobe lighting to create the illusion of figures ‘dancing’ to Michael Jackson beat.
description_for_label: Free-standing Zoetrope using strobe lighting to create the illusion of figures ‘dancing’ to Michael Jackson beat.
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Swarm
results.brief_description:
Sound and image projection specifically commissioned for Eyes Lies and Illusions in 2006.

Swarm, in the tradition of the phantasmagoria, hides the technology by which its effects are created. Multiple projections, motion sensors and speakers create the sense that the gallery is inhabited by insects, which emerge from a throbbing hive in a dark corner of the building to fly across the displays or swoop around visitors to the gallery. The work is unable to be seen in its entirety from any one place, it has no frame, no apparent beginning nor end. The bugs are free to move through the gallery space, just as we are. Swarm reacts to our presence, yet is beyond our control.

results.title: By the light of the moon
results.creator_credit: Broadmeadows Secondary College, Christine Rogers, Media, Applied Communications, RMIT and Alex Vagic
results.brief_description: “By the light of the moon” tells the story of two refugee girls, their reasons for leaving their home countries, their experiences, and how they came to be living in Broadmeadows and attending the Broadmeadows Secondary College. Essentially the film is about hope and optimism. Despite the difficulties faced by the two girls, and an acknowledgement that they can never forget the past, through sharing their stories they gain acceptance. They begin to connect with the community in which they now live, and have hope for the future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Broadmeadows Secondary College, Christine Rogers, Media, Applied Communications, RMIT and Alex Vagic
